column5: Yesterday, Valcourt, Quebec-based Bombardier Recreational Products (BRP), the parent company to Evinrude, announced that it has signed an agreement with Tohatsu Corporation in order to be able to offer Evinrude-branded outboard engines from 3.5 to 15 HP. The new engines will be available at BRP dealerships in early 2012.  Clickto read more.
Are they going to be 4 strokes then? Very interesting.
I have herd good things about those engines. Concidering buying a 15hrs. Any one know who the parent company is ??(to tohatsu?)
I thought small Mercs were Tohatsu's too, looks like they'll have the market cornered

So far as I know Tohatsu is the parent company. They make all sorts of small engines - outboards included.  Scugog - it would appear that yes, they will be four-strokes.  Dave - Yup, they should be more or less identical to Mercury's small outboards, and of course, Tohatsu's own-branded engines.  The Johnson four-strokes that BRP used to sell were made by Suzuki.  Definitely interesting times.  In Vancouver tonight for a trade show that starts tomorrow. Wish I was fishing.
Tohatsu also makes the nissan line of small motors. Should make it easy for parts!

I love Tohatsu!!.....bought a new Tohatsu 40HP 2 stroke back in 1994 along with a 20' pontoon boat.....sold the boat and motor last year and the motor was as good as new!!  Upgraded to a 20' fishing boat and bought an 8HP 4 stroke Tohastu kicker last year....runs great and it was much cheaper $$$$$$$$$$ than any other motors out on the  market!!
hmmmm you learn something new everyday, never knew that!  Good info, thanks   d
My brother got a 9.8 T (4 stroke) a couple of seasons ago & it runs great and good on fuel.......
thanks for the info craig !! thats interesting,didnt realize tohatsu was that big of a company,i have seen their outboards in canadian tire many times....cheers
